definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Her dark hair waved untidy across her broad forehead.
sentences.chinese: 她的黑髮散亂地飄拂在寬闊的腦門子上。

sentences.english: He had thick veins in his forehead, a little nose, and a large chin.
sentences.chinese: 他腦門子上青筋很粗，鼻子很小，下巴可又很大。
